New Records: Ireland posted their highest total against South Africa in a T20I match
Ross Adair scored the first century by an Irish batter in the format at the Zayed Cricket Stadium
Mark Adair took 4 wickets for 31 runs, his best figures in T20Is
Key Match Events: Ross Adair scored a 57-ball hundred, his first in T20Is
Mark Adair took 4 wickets for 31 runs to seal the win
Ireland's 195/6 was their highest total against South Africa in a T20I match
Pre-Game Insights: No specific pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland captain Paul Stirling expressed pride in the team's performance
Ross Adair reflected on his near misses and expressed gratitude for his brother's support
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa gave away only 19 runs in the last three overs to keep Ireland under 200
Lungi Ngidi's over of slower balls helped strangle Ireland in the end overs
Matthew Humphreys celebrated his 22nd birthday with a trip to the Abu Dhabi Louvre and took his first wicket of the series
Others: Ireland became the first team to win a match batting first at the Zayed Cricket Stadium in the last eight T20Is at the venue
Ireland levelled the series with this win
